Results.Title: Lousy bike for the price
Results.ReviewText: Lousy bike for the price. I have had Trek's, Giants, aluminum frames, carbon frames and this bike simply cannot compete with the bike shop brands. The Shimano 105 and BB30 crank is almost impossible to find in this price range. The assembly was lengthy and difficult and I was disappointed with the gear shift and the ride quality once I FINALLY got it set up. I swapped out the rims, which I think are the biggest downfall about the bike. Save yourself a headache and skip this bike.

Results.Title: Triathlon + This Bike
Results.ReviewText: Just finished triathlon in Sandestin.. Great ride! 20 miles in 52 min my first race. I had my local bike shop put it together the only change I suggest is some better tires the upgrade is about $70 per tire.

Results.Title: Ex mountain biker loves this bike
Results.ReviewText: This is my first road bike, having been on a mountain bike or running for 25 years. I'm not getting a lot of road time as it's very winter here in the northeast. But my time on the trainer has been quite comfortable right from the start. It has been designed to specifically fit a woman, but the first thing we had to do was switch out the stem to a longer one to accommodate my longer upper body. However the Decoupler is a noticeable feature adding to the smooth ride. Other than that I am very pleased with my new Endurance!

Results.Title: As advertised
Results.ReviewText: This bike does what I need it to do - go from home to work and back a few days a week. Let's me keep my more expensive Scott bike for racing and distance training. I was surprised at what I could get for the money - this will not be confused with a high end racer but it's all you can ask for given the price.

Results.Title: Love the Apex 2
Results.ReviewText: I ended up getting the Apex 2 from a local dealer since they were the only one who had my size. I absolutely love this bike. It is comfortable, fast and you can actually tell how aerodynamic it is. I just completed my first half century and if I was riding with people as soon as I went to the lower bar on the hills I would immediately pull away from people without even trying. My top speed on the decents was 49.2 mph vs my riding partners being 45 and 42. It rides great and is simply a great bike all round. For the price you really can't beat it. And it really does look sharp. My husband can hardly keep up. :)

Results.Title: Excited
Results.ReviewText: I received my Endurance Apex 2 from FedEx & when i unboxed it i was excited with the paint & graphics... I took my Endurance to one of the local bicycle shop because the handel Bars, front brakes & gearing cables needed to be set up & routed through the carbon frame... When i picked up my Apex 2from the bicycle shop, the bike tech. was very impressed with overall setup from the Quality of the Frame to the rims to the gearing including the FSA crank...

Results.Title: So light
Results.ReviewText: I am retired and like to ride on paved bike paths for 10 to 30 miles several times a week. Compared to my Trek Hybrid, the Apex 2 is so light, about 20% lighter as configured. Smooth shifting and very fast. The seat could be more comfortable as after a two hour or longer ride you wish it were. I did have one minor problem with the bike after about 300 miles, the rear brake cable let loose. No biggie, just reattached and tightened.

Results.Title: Great technology
Results.ReviewText: Having never seen this before, all I can say is Wow! There are so many things on this bike I don't recognize...and I ride. Alot. This leads me to believe only one thing. Endurance clearly has some new biking technology that they are just now bestowing on the rest of the biking world. spokes. This is superb! And a 11 speed drive train? I new I wasting all sorts of efficiency on my Shimano 20 speed. And by the looks of the break levers, this bike will no doubt usher in a new age of ergo-comfort cycling. And all of this on Endurance's classic Apex platform. And let's not forget the most space-age of aluminum alloys.

Results.Title: Great gearing for hills
Results.ReviewText: I love my Apex 2! I cycle 200 km a week for exercise. It has the gearing is great for steep hills and rolling country sides. Despite being a relatively entry level road bike, it is perfect for me and so light that I can easily mount it onto my roof bike rack.

Results.Title: Matte finish is nice
Results.ReviewText: I love it. Endurance has always been one of my favorite brands.The body style with the matte finish is nice and really stands out from other bikes. The shifting with the 105 is perfect. All the other out of box components are pretty good. I had one issue with the tires and had to change them out.

Results.Title: Torturous seat
Results.ReviewText: This bike is awesome - big EXCEPT. The seat will kill you! :) It is my first road bike, but I have already ridden it successfully for a few long rides (20 to 50K)! The only thing I would change about it are the seat (it is an instrument of torture). The seat made me so crazy I had to bump it from 5 stars down to 3. Invest in a new seat and you'll be happy.

Results.Title: Comfortable
Results.ReviewText: The Endurance Apex 2 has been a wonderful bike so far. I am very pleased with how comfortable the seat is and how natural it feels to ride the bike. As a beginning cyclist training for my first triathlon, I feel confident training on the Apex. It has been very good not only on flat rides and ascents and descents alike. It has a good amount of gear options and the brakes are responsive. I would definitely recommend this bike!

Results.Title: Great on climbs
Results.ReviewText: Love the mean look of this shiney black & white bike, I have the Apex 1 which I love but the Apex 2 is lighter and is so fast! The gearing is great on the climbs and it descends really well and the flats are a joy. Internal cable routing keeps it tidy and looking great.

Results.Title: Great value for everyday riding
Results.ReviewText: I've only had my Apex about 4 months. It's my third bike since I started road riding and it is a great value - great for everyday riding. I plan to eventually replace the stock tires with Vittoria CTS for better flat protection but I can't complain and would buy this again. Good combination of weight, price, comfort.

Results.Title: First real bike
Results.ReviewText: I bought this bike to ride with my husband. It is my first 'real' bike and I love it. I had to change out the saddle - replaced it with a Bontrager WSD seat of a slightly different width. That did the trick, it feels great! Now if I could only keep up with my husband on his Endurance Storm....

Results.Title: Flat tires
Results.ReviewText: I have owned this bike or 5 months now and already have had sometihng like 6 flat tires. Very frustrating. Nothing like making time for a nice 3 hour ride and then having it ruined by a flat. Maybe I should have stuck with running. Not a fan of Endurance.

ClientResponses.Name: Endurance Cycles
ClientResponses.Response: I’m sorry to hear of your experience. We highly recommend you get custom fitted for any road bike, including Endurance. It is possible to make many adjustments on the Apex 2 – including handlebar height & angle and seat height & angle – that may help minimize hand and shoulder pain. Lastly, as a rider myself, I know flats are frustrating. It may be that you have just been unlucky, but if you have any particular issues with your route, such as a lot of new construction with related road debris, then also ask during your custom fitting about tires that may be better suited to your route.

Results.Title: Perfect for Travel
Results.ReviewText: I own the Apex 1. I thought I would review purely from a reliability standpoint - I travel a LOT. Several of the places I go, I've brought my Endurance. Packs up in about 15 minutes with little tools, and reassembly is just as easy. I am not even sure how many miles I've put on mine but it has been a TON - It's been packed and unpacked several times and other than a few cosmetic dings and one scratch (woops) - mechanically it's still a very sound bike. I feel like I've beat on it pretty hard and its still going strong. I road ride it, put it on a trainer, i've had it in some extreme environments - heat/humidity, and as I mentioned above; it's still going strong. Great first Tri Bike if you're thinking of buying one

Results.Title: Smooth operator
Results.ReviewText: I purchased this bike about three weeks ago. It is my second road bike. The first was the Challenger model. This bike is definately a smooth operator. I could not tell that I was shifting it was so smooth and quiet. It handles like a dream. Like many other Endurance bikes I have tested, this one is perfectly made to fit me. When I got fitted on it, the bike shop showed me the coolest feature. The ability to move the brake levers closer to me so I do not have to be stuck in one hand position in the drops. The Endurance Apex 2 is definately the perfect bike for me!

Results.Title: Great components
Results.ReviewText: I bought thisb/c it had the better components: FSA crank and 105 rear mech. I was not disappointed. The color is a nice flat black, easy to keep clean. The build quality is great and it is an excellent entry-level road bike. The wheelset is not bad, about 2000g....not aero, but at this price/level riders like me don't need aero wheels. Front rim is radial spoked, the rear is 2x. Most of the bargain wheelsets you can buy are about the same weight or heavier so stick with the wheelset on it until you're read to spend $300-$450 on a decent set. Personally, I'd buy a set of rims and the hubs I want and take them to my LBS; you'll get what you want and get better quality for your money. Brakes are OK, I already switched mine to 105 front/rear and better pads but the Pro-Max brakes do work just OK to start. Something to note, my front brake did NOT come installed so you need to know at least a little bit to get it ready to ride, or take it to your local dealer and have them do a pro-tune on it. Worth the money and definitely worth introducing yourself to your local dealer because you will need them sooner or later. Saddle is junk, toss it, I'm using Planet Bike 5020 Women's ARS Standard Anatomic Relief Saddle with Gel and it's great. Pedals I didn't even use, immediately installed my Delta Exustars, but the boxed pedals come with toe clips/straps. I'm not sure why seats are included on bikes like this, because many riders have their own preferences.

Results.Title: 200 miles!
Results.ReviewText: Just finished an inaugural 200 mile ride. I replaced the Oval brand seat with a Brooks seat and that was really the only thing that I have found lacking so far. We had to traverse a mile or so of crushed gravel road and the tires held up well. I'm really enjoying the bike
